en: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? The lovingkindness of God endureth continually.
hmr: Aw mi hrât, iengdinga thil suksuol i sawng am a na? Pathien zaidamna chu a um zing hlak a nih.

en: Thy tongue deviseth very wickedness, Like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
hmr: Thil suol tak thaw i suongtuo hlak a, I lei chu rêpvâw chem ngeitak ang a na, Khêlhlip a sâksuok hlak.

en: Thou lovest evil more than good, And lying rather than to speak righteousness. [Selah
hmr: Ṭhat nêkin suol i ngaina lem a, Thu indiktak hril nêkin khêlthu hril i ngaina lem bawk a.

en: Thou lovest all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.
hmr: Aw, nang lei mi hlêmnghal, Thu mi lem zo thei po po chu i ngaina hlak.

en: God will likewise destroy thee for ever; He will take thee up, and pluck thee out of thy tent, And root thee out of the land of the living. [Selah
hmr: Pathien chun kumkhawtluonga dingin sukse vêng a ti che, Man a ti cheh a, i umnaa inthawkin kei dawk a ti cheh a, Mi hring rama inthawk hin kei suok dai a ti che.

en: The righteous also shall see it, and fear, And shall laugh at him, saying,
hmr: Mi felhai khawmin an hmu chun ṭîng an ta, Nuisan an tih.

en: Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength, But trusted in the abundance of his riches, And strengthened himself in his wickedness.
hmr: “En ta u, hi mi hi a nih, Pathien a kulbînga siem nuom lo a, A hausakna nasatak ring lem a, A suolnaa insukhrât vei chu,” tiin.

en: But as for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God: I trust in the lovingkindness of God for ever and ever.
hmr: Kei ruok chu chu Pathien ina oliv thing inder hlut hlut ang ka na, Pathien zainêmna chu kum- khawtluongin ring ka tih.

en: I will give thee thanks for ever, because thou hast done it; And I will hope in thy name, for it is good, in the presence of thy saints.
hmr: Chu chu i thaw leiin kumkhuoin lâwmthu hril ka ti cheh a, I mi inthienghai mithmua chun i hming chu nghâk zing ka tih, a ṭha sih a.
